content.description: This beautiful little crack splits the left side of the cliff packs a whole lot of fun into a pint sized fissure. I would so love for it to be a good bit longer but given what we've got, it's still well worth playing on. Thought it is a trad route it can be easily set up on TR after climbing Hedwig's.
content.protection: trad gear to lower offs. Thought it is a trad route it can be easily set up on TR after climbing Hedwig's.
content.location: The crack in the left side of welcome wall.

content.description: It is just one of those routes that feels like it was made to be climbed. I think it has 4 star movement but it's shorter length leaves me giving it 3.5 stars (which isn't an option so I gave it 3). Anyway follow the cracked rock up and then right. Move up past bolt #3 as the holds get smaller and make an improbable traverse back to the left (clipping bolt #4) along a sequence of crimps in a seam. Now all that's left is to make that last move up onto the slab... you've got this.
content.location: From the sweet little crack this is the second route to the right.

content.description: On the left side of the cliff. Pull a steeper tricky section to get up onto the lower angle slab. You will feel the opening moves in your upper body for sure. The upper bit is 100% footwork.
content.location: Left most climb on the cliff.

content.description: When lowering off of Hedwig's Haunt you lower right down this line. It would be a squeeze if it got bolted but it is pretty fun and worth describing. Climb the big obvious crack/flake starting at the base of Spring Song up and to the left. Mantle up so your feet are in the crack and delicately make your way up and left meeting up with the anchor and maybe the last few moves of Hedwig's.
content.location: Between the bolt line and the crack.

content.description: As with the other routes here, expect a lot of climbing in a short piece of rock. The first half is powerful and sequential to a good jug. Then you have to make really cool moves up and over a bulge onto the short slab above. Once established on your feet up there it's just a few moves to the anchor.
content.location: This is the first bolted route to the right of the nice little crack.

content.description: This is a pleasant micro crag that will be the first climbable rock you see when you walk the trail in from the gait. a couple of easy ones and a couple of harder ones. Maybe it will work into your warmup/cool down somewhere. The cliff faces the road which is pretty close with a stream running between. It get's lots of sun. The rock is really pretty and the movement is fun. Enjoy.
